8fbb2ccb2381e11a36242be04474bdec (02:27): got my list-in-list to work the way i want.
8fbb2ccb2381e11a36242be04474bdec (02:27): the solution was simple, render the title (first li in a set) w/ position:outside, and type:hidden

8fbb2ccb2381e11a36242be04474bdec (02:29): the visibility:hidden, will render the whole bullet invisibile in FF (so the text will be flush to margin), and in IE where it would normally remain a 10px transparent graphic with padding/margin, i render it outside, so no browser-specific hacks

850a2e5c449637a6893fabbd39d2c502 (02:30): how come putting a position: absolute; breaks the box? i.e. my stuff get's outside it (I'm setting the left position, and the thing gets below my box. or rather, the box stops before it)
850a2e5c449637a6893fabbd39d2c502 (02:32): using position: relative; doesn't do that, but then the text gets position relative the content. and the content varies, so that doesn't look good
21d0e26d0b99b0d483771d5426e8c5aa (02:36): ok, notice the scrollbar at that link? i don't want it

4e96fd19b7450b0fe822449638fe1499 (02:45): auk: Putting a padding on something with width: 100% is a bad idea.
4e96fd19b7450b0fe822449638fe1499 (02:46): (width is the width of the inner content area)
21d0e26d0b99b0d483771d5426e8c5aa (02:47): DRMacIver: i've been bit by it before, but i never seem to learn
4e96fd19b7450b0fe822449638fe1499 (02:48): auk: To be honest, width 100% is, most of the time, just a plain bad idea. :)
4e96fd19b7450b0fe822449638fe1499 (02:49): If you use it you can't stick left-right paddings or borders on your element.
4e96fd19b7450b0fe822449638fe1499 (02:50): (Which isn't to say you should never use it. But be careful. :) )
c95720c193df40ce1618d1b00b040b42 (02:51): CSS: Not valid - Errors: 2, Warnings: 147, http://jigsaw.w3.org/css-validator/validator?uri=http://cvs.logrus.com/jakeg/

145b07822ce0c3b39b8937c979ce5dc1 (02:56): folks, I want to make a div or iframe inside my page, because I have a huuuuge single line (result from another page) so I kinda need something that will keep the layout as it as. how can I do that?
145b07822ce0c3b39b8937c979ce5dc1 (03:06): nemo_work ok, can I force the scroolbar to appear at the top of the "box"?
145b07822ce0c3b39b8937c979ce5dc1 (03:07): yeah, noticed... ok, can't I force it than to "split" the long lines?
1ed63740b62505736586b09814ca7ea9 (03:07): actually. I was looking at that earlier
145b07822ce0c3b39b8937c979ce5dc1 (03:07): yay, can you please tell me how?
1ed63740b62505736586b09814ca7ea9 (03:10): Razva: if you're referring to splitting in the middle of a word...

1ed63740b62505736586b09814ca7ea9 (03:11): that will require explicit javascript to force it.  there is no spec to support that, and difficult to define how a browser would do it without confusing text (visualise a break in the middle of a URL)
145b07822ce0c3b39b8937c979ce5dc1 (03:11): ok, and the div id is white-space or...?
1ed63740b62505736586b09814ca7ea9 (03:11): pre-wrap and its variants only enforce wrapping on words when in a mode like pre which doesn't normally auto wrap
145b07822ce0c3b39b8937c979ce5dc1 (03:12): or should I just...insert it into the page?
1ed63740b62505736586b09814ca7ea9 (03:12): Razva: the one I just pasted you is for a pre tag silly
1ed63740b62505736586b09814ca7ea9 (03:12): Razva: I discovered, btw, that that one only works in IE if the element the pre tag is in has a fixed size.
1ed63740b62505736586b09814ca7ea9 (03:12): actually, discovered that a few months ago, then promptly forgot it again today :)
1ed63740b62505736586b09814ca7ea9 (03:13): Razva: anyway, if the long line has no whitespace, and you are wanting to force a wrap, you will need javascript
145b07822ce0c3b39b8937c979ce5dc1 (03:13): it's having a lot of white spaces
145b07822ce0c3b39b8937c979ce5dc1 (03:14): ok, so in a "push the button" phrase, should I paste the code into the style?

38ced805a9bc0b0aeec522d21f376b73 (03:15): I have a div tag named "wrap", and inside that I have another div tag named "left". the left div tag contains a background image I want to have with 100% height no mather how long the wrap tag is. any ideas how to fix this?
1ed63740b62505736586b09814ca7ea9 (03:17): Razva: did you test it in IE too?
1ed63740b62505736586b09814ca7ea9 (03:18): Razva: as noted, I had to set a width="540px" on the containing element in this stupid ugly mix of html and css I'm working with
1ed63740b62505736586b09814ca7ea9 (03:20): interesting coincidence that I dropped by for exactly that
